biography.summary: Ruben Gallego is a Democratic U.S. Senator from Arizona, former U.S. Representative, known for his work on national security, veterans' affairs, and immigration reform.
biography.early_life: Born in 1979 in Chicago, Illinois; raised in the Phoenix area.
biography.education: Attended Arizona State University, studied political science.
biography.career: Former U.S. Representative for Arizona's 7th and 3rd districts (2015â€“2025). U.S. Marine Corps veteran and public servant.

contact.office_address: 302 Hart Senate Office Building Washington DC 20510

bills_sponsored.title: The American Jobs and Security Act
bills_sponsored.summary: A bill to promote national security and economic growth through investments in infrastructure and defense.

bills_sponsored.title: Immigration Reform and Border Security Act
bills_sponsored.summary: A bill to reform immigration policy and strengthen border security while protecting workers.

timeline.event: Elected to U.S. House of Representatives from Arizona's 7th district.
Re-elected to serve as U.S. Representative (continued office).
Elected to the United States Senate representing Arizona.
